Annotation.String: The DellOSDeploymentService resource provides some actions to support OS deployment configurations.
The DellOSDeploymentService resource provides some actions to support OS deployment configurations.
The BootToHD() method is used for one time boot to the host server's hard disk.
The BootToHD() method is used for one time boot to the host server's hard disk.

The BootToISOFromVFlash() method boots to the pre-operating system image downloaded on the vFlash SD card. The following table lists the return values for BootToISOFromVFlash() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return-code description. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.

The BootToISOFromVFlash() method boots to the pre-operating system image downloaded on the vFlash SD card. The following table lists the return values for BootToISOFromVFlash() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return-code description. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.

Identifies the amount of time up to 18 hours for the drivers to be exposed as an USB device to the host. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified.The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)

Identifies the amount of time up to 18 hours for the drivers to be exposed as an USB device to the host. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified.The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)
The BootToNetworkISO() method is used to boot to the iDRAC pre-operating system image that was already downloaded.
The BootToNetworkISO() method is used to boot to the iDRAC pre-operating system image that was already downloaded.
Identifies the amount of time (up to 18 hours) for the ISO Image to be exposed as a local CD-ROM device to the host. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)
Identifies the amount of time (up to 18 hours) for the ISO Image to be exposed as a local CD-ROM device to the host. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)

Folder Name containing the ISO.

Checksum value in string format computed using 'HashType' algorithm.
Checksum value in string format computed using 'HashType' algorithm.

NFS or CIFS share IPv4 address. For example, 192.168.10.100.

Password, if applicable.

Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.
Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.
Type of the Network Share.
Type of the Network Share.

UserName, if applicable. If the value contains domain name e.g. domain name/UserName, the "domain name" will be considered as Work group. Work group parameter will take precedence if value is separately passed for it along with UserName. Supports only '' and '/' for seperator.

UserName, if applicable. If the value contains domain name e.g. domain name/UserName, the "domain name" will be considered as Work group. Work group parameter will take precedence if value is separately passed for it along with UserName. Supports only '' and '/' for seperator.
Workgroup for the CIFS share, optional.
Workgroup for the CIFS share, optional.

The ConfigurableBootToNetworkISO() method exposes an ISO Image present on a network share as a CDROM device to the host server for a specified exposure duration interval or by default for 18 hrs. Upon the successful execution, based on the ResetType parameter, the host system shall either immediately cold boot or warm boot. Upon this reset, the system shall then boot to the ISO Image. If ResetType specifies no immediate reboot, then upon the next host system reset, the system shall boot to the ISO Image. Furthermore, if immediate reset is not specified, then the system should be rebooted before the exposure duration interval expires, otherwise the system shall fail to boot to the ISO Image.

The ConfigurableBootToNetworkISO() method exposes an ISO Image present on a network share as a CDROM device to the host server for a specified exposure duration interval or by default for 18 hrs. Upon the successful execution, based on the ResetType parameter, the host system shall either immediately cold boot or warm boot. Upon this reset, the system shall then boot to the ISO Image. If ResetType specifies no immediate reboot, then upon the next host system reset, the system shall boot to the ISO Image. Furthermore, if immediate reset is not specified, then the system should be rebooted before the exposure duration interval expires, otherwise the system shall fail to boot to the ISO Image.

Identifies the amount of time (up to 18 hours) for the ISO Image to be exposed as a local CD-ROM device to the host server after which it will be automatically detached. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)

Identifies the amount of time (up to 18 hours) for the ISO Image to be exposed as a local CD-ROM device to the host server after which it will be automatically detached. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)
Type of hash algorithm used to compute checksum.
Type of hash algorithm used to compute checksum.
Checksum value in string format computed using 'HashType' algorithm.
Checksum value in string format computed using 'HashType' algorithm.
NFS or CIFS share IPv4 address. For example, 192.168.10.100.
NFS or CIFS share IPv4 address. For example, 192.168.10.100.
Name of the image file.
Name of the image file.
Password, if applicable.
Password, if applicable.
Specifies if the host system needs to be immediately forced to cold/warm reset in order to boot to the ISO Image.
Specifies if the host system needs to be immediately forced to cold/warm reset in order to boot to the ISO Image.
Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.
Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.
Type of the Network Share.
Type of the Network Share.
UserName, if applicable.
UserName, if applicable.

Workgroup for the CIFS share, optional.

The ConnectNetworkISOImage() method is used to connect to the ISO present on the network share and expose the ISO as a local USB CD-ROM device to the host system. This method will connect to the ISO located on an NFS/CIFS share and expose it as a virtual CDROM device to the host server. Even though the successful method execution shall not change the boot order of that device, the host shall always boot to the virtual CDROM. Also note that after the ISO is exposed to the host server, Lifecycle Controller shall be locked and no other jobs like configuration/update etc shall be performed until the ISO is detached using the DisconnectNetworkISOImage() method. The successful exection of the DisconnectNetworkISOImage() shall revert the host system to the regular boot list. NOTE: The recommended methodology for connecting to an ISO image is by using the ConnectRFSISOImage() method that utilizes the remote file system (RFS).

The ConnectNetworkISOImage() method is used to connect to the ISO present on the network share and expose the ISO as a local USB CD-ROM device to the host system. This method will connect to the ISO located on an NFS/CIFS share and expose it as a virtual CDROM device to the host server. Even though the successful method execution shall not change the boot order of that device, the host shall always boot to the virtual CDROM. Also note that after the ISO is exposed to the host server, Lifecycle Controller shall be locked and no other jobs like configuration/update etc shall be performed until the ISO is detached using the DisconnectNetworkISOImage() method. The successful exection of the DisconnectNetworkISOImage() shall revert the host system to the regular boot list. NOTE: The recommended methodology for connecting to an ISO image is by using the ConnectRFSISOImage() method that utilizes the remote file system (RFS).

Checksum value in string format computed using HashType algorithm.
Checksum value in string format computed using HashType algorithm.

CIFS or NFS share IPv4 address. For example, 192.168.10.100.

Name of the image file.

Password of the account to access the share.
Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.
Name of the CIFS share or full path to the NFS share. Optional for HTTP/HTTPS share (if supported), this may be treated as the path of the directory containing the file.

The DeleteISOFromVFlash() method deletes the ISO Image from vFlash SD card. The following table lists the return values for the DeleteISOFromVFlash() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return-code description. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.

The DeleteISOFromVFlash() method deletes the ISO Image from vFlash SD card. The following table lists the return values for the DeleteISOFromVFlash() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return-code description. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.
This OSDeploymentService.DetachDrivers() method is used to detach the USB device containing the drivers from the host server.
This OSDeploymentService.DetachDrivers() method is used to detach the USB device containing the drivers from the host server.

The DetachISOFromVFlash() method is used to detach the ISO Image on a vFlash SD card from the host system. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.

The DetachISOFromVFlash() method is used to detach the ISO Image on a vFlash SD card from the host system. Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.
The DetachISOImage() method is used to detach the ISO Image from the host server.
The DetachISOImage() method is used to detach the ISO Image from the host server.
The DisconnectNetworkISOImage() method is used to disconnect and detach the ISO Image from the host system.
The DisconnectNetworkISOImage() method is used to disconnect and detach the ISO Image from the host system.

The following table lists the return values for DownloadISOToVFlash() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return-code description.Note: This method will not be supported in Poweredge systems with model YX5X and iDRAC firmware version 4.00.00.00 or later.

The GetAttachStatus() method will give the status of the Drivers and ISO Image that has been exposed to host.
The GetAttachStatus() method will give the status of the Drivers and ISO Image that has been exposed to host.
The GetDriverPackInfo() method is used get the list of operating systems that can be installed on the host system using the embedded device drivers present in the Lifecycle Controller.
The GetDriverPackInfo() method is used get the list of operating systems that can be installed on the host system using the embedded device drivers present in the Lifecycle Controller.
The GetNetworkISOImageConnectionInfo() method is used to give the status of the ISO Image that has been exposed to the host system.
The GetNetworkISOImageConnectionInfo() method is used to give the status of the ISO Image that has been exposed to the host system.
The SkipISOImageBoot() method allows the BIOS to skip booting to the ISO image once and boot normally to the first device in the boot list.
The SkipISOImageBoot() method allows the BIOS to skip booting to the ISO image once and boot normally to the first device in the boot list.

The UnpackAndAttach() method is used to extract the drivers for the selected operating system to a USB device that is attached locally to the server for the specified time interval. The following talbe specifies the return values for UnpackAndAttach() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return- code description.

The UnpackAndAttach() method is used to extract the drivers for the selected operating system to a USB device that is attached locally to the server for the specified time interval. The following talbe specifies the return values for UnpackAndAttach() method, where the method-execution behavior matches the return- code description.

Identifies the amount of time up to 18 hours for the drivers to be exposed as an USB device to the host. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)

Identifies the amount of time up to 18 hours for the drivers to be exposed as an USB device to the host. The default value shall be 18 hrs, if the parameter is not specified. The format for intervals is: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.SSS](Z|(+|-)hh:mm)
Name of the OS to unpack drivers for, this value shall match one of the strings in OSList returned for GetDriverPackInfo.
Name of the OS to unpack drivers for, this value shall match one of the strings in OSList returned for GetDriverPackInfo.
The UnpackAndShare() method is used to extract the drivers for the selected operating system, and copy them to the specified network share.
The UnpackAndShare() method is used to extract the drivers for the selected operating system, and copy them to the specified network share.
